intro: Lessingia albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Cariophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, white, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are generally succulent, helping to store water, while its flowers bloom in early spring. Lessingia albiflora is often found in open habitats such as slopes and gravelly plains.
